intro: Manulea uncinata, commonly known as the hooked manulea, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes caraway and parsley. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels. Its leaves are pinnately divided, giving it a delicate, fern-like appearance. Manulea uncinata is typically found in rocky or coastal habitats, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
